title: How can people differentiate solipsism from madness? - Quora

response.answer_text: My abnormal psychology professor once read out two pieces of writing. Both were fairly incoherent stream of consciousness stuff. One was by a schizophrenic patient of his, the other by Noble prize winner James Joyce. It was impossible to distinguish them. We don't use the term madness nowadays. It's all about how the patient copes with life. A cynic is what an optimist calls a realist
